
---
layout: post
title:  'VG-dependencies-between-controls'
author: 'jakub.siuda@exceedra.com'
exerpt: >
  How to create a dependency between controls in the vertical grid. 

---

  <p>By a dependency we understand the situation when changing the value (or the selection) of the first control triggers the second control to update its state.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 1.42857; font-size: 16px;"><strong>1. Before we start</strong></span></p>
<p>Let's say I want to have a date picker and a dropdown. Whenever I change the date of the datepicker I want the dropdown to execute its procedure, sending the date I've selected in the xml in.<br />
We can start with creating a simple vertical grid with the two controls I mentioned above:<br />
<br />
</p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DatePicker&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter2&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;Dropdown&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSource&gt;ProcToBeExecuted&lt;/DataSource&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSourceInput&gt;&amp;lt;User_Idx /&amp;gt;&lt;/DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>This xml should create the result below:</p>
<p><img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>2. Creating the dependency</strong></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">We need to take two more steps in order to make our controls working as expected.<br />
The first step is to make the second filter dependent on the first one:</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DatePicker&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br /><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumn&gt;Filter2&lt;/DependentColumn&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/DependentColumns&gt;</strong><br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter2&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;Dropdown&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSource&gt;ProcToBeExecuted&lt;/DataSource&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSourceInput&gt;&amp;lt;User_Idx /&amp;gt;&lt;/DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The second step is to instruct the dropdown to include the date from the date picker into its xml-in when calling the proc.<br />
We do that by editing the DataSourceInput node in the following way:</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DatePicker&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumn&gt;Filter2&lt;/DependentColumn&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/DependentColumns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter2&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;Dropdown&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSource&gt;ProcToBeExecuted&lt;/DataSource&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;User_Idx/&gt;<br /><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlsWithInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Columns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Column&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Values /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Column&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Columns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/ControlsWithInput&gt;</strong><br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The "ControlsWithInput" node tells the control to look for values in other controls in this vertical grid. Later on you just need to specify the column code of the control you want to have values from and add the "Values" node where these values will be stored once the proc is executed.<br />
<br />
You can see how this works on the screenshot below:</p>
<div>&nbsp;</div>
<p>
<img alt="" src="/media/VerticalGrid/VgDependencies1.png" /></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3. Creating a dependency for controls in different columns</strong></span></p>
<p>You can also create dependencies between controls contained in different columns. This process, in fact, is not different from what we've achieved before.<br />
See slightly different xml having our date picker and dropdown in two different columns and working the same exact way.</p>
<p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DatePicker&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DependentColumn&gt;Filter2&lt;/DependentColumn&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/DependentColumns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter2&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;Dropdown&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSource&gt;ProcToBeExecuted&lt;/DataSource&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;User_Idx/&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlsWithInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Columns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Column&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;Filter1&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Values /&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Column&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Columns&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/ControlsWithInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/DataSourceInput&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
</p>
<p><img alt="" src="/media/VerticalGrid/VgDependencies2.png" /></p>
